clinical_study.brief_title: Vigamox Treatment for Ocular Graft-Versus-Host Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Topical Vigamox in the Initial Management of Ocular Graft-Versus-Host Disease

brief_summary.textblock: In this study the investigators seek to prospectively measure the response of ocular graft-versus-host disease (GVHD) patients to treatment with topical Vigamox. The investigators will accomplish this by enrolling patients with bilateral ocular GVHD and treating one eye with topical Vigamox and the other eye with a placebo eye drop. By assessing the response to treatment with Vigamox, the investigators hope to identify a role for topical antibiotic treatment in ocular GVHD.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The eyes of each enrolled participant will be randomized such that one eye is treated with Vigamox and the other eye is treated with a placebo eye drop.

primary_outcome.time_frame: First clinic visit through second clinic visit (estimated to be 9-14 days)
primary_outcome.description: Ocular comfort will be rated by the participant for each eye on a 0-10 Visual Analog Scale 0=no discomfort and 10=worst discomfort

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First clinic visit through second clinic visit (estimated to be 9-14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Degree of Conjunctival injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First clinic visit through second clinic visit (estimated to be 9-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: -The degree of conjunctival injection will be graded based on the Validated Bulbar Redness scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Corneal/conjunctival punctate epithelial erosions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First clinic visit through second clinic visit (estimated to be 9-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: The clinical exam will be conducted using the National Eye Institute Fluorescein Staining Scale to grade the degree of corneal and conjunctival stain with a cobalt blue slit lamp filter This test divides the cornea into 5 sections. Staining is graded on a scale of 0-3, with 0 indicating absence of staining and 3 indicating severe staining.

secondary_outcome.description: -Conjunctival bacterial cultures will be obtained via swab before and after treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Participants will be adults with a history of allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation, signs of either acute or chronic GVHD per the hematologist, signs and symptoms consistent with ocular GVHD + within 4 months of developing symptoms of ocular GVHD
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treated with antibiotic eye drops in the month prior to enrollment
- History of fluoroquinolone allergy
- Asymmetric ocular disease
- Pregnant
- Nursing
